question: A.02 As power level increases, the Prompt Negative Temp. Coefficient (PNTC) causes:

answers.answer: 238U to absorb neutrons over a wider range, thus decreasing the number of neutrons available for fission with 235U.
answers.feedback: Correct. REFERENCE: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A., Nuclear Reactor Engineering, 1991, § 5.98, p. 94.
Incorrect. REFERENCE: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A., Nuclear Reactor Engineering, 1991, § 5.98, p. 94.

answers.answer: The hydrogen atoms in the ZrH2 to slow down more neutrons.

answers.answer: More thermal neutron absorption by the moderator.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A., Nuclear Reactor Engineering, 1991, § 5.98, p. 94.

question: A.03 Which ONE of the following statements correctly describes the influence of delayed neutrons on the neutron life cycle?

answers.answer: Delayed neutrons decrease the average period of a reactivity addition because they thermalize more quickly than prompt neutrons.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A., Nuclear Reactor Engineering, 1991, § 5.20, p. 236.

answers.answer: Delayed neutrons take longer to thermalize because they are born at higher energies than prompt neutrons.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A., Nuclear Reactor Engineering, 1991, § 5.20, p. 236.

answers.answer: Delayed neutrons cause the length of the average neutron generation time to increase.
answers.feedback: Correct. REFERENCE: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A., Nuclear Reactor Engineering, 1991, § 5.20, p. 236.

answers.answer: Delayed neutrons are born later than prompt neutrons and make up a larger fraction of the fission neutrons.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A., Nuclear Reactor Engineering, 1991, § 5.20, p. 236.
